March 12, 1962
Mr* Harry D* Lamb* Director
Radio-XV Education Department
Toledo Public Schools
1901 West Central Avenue
Toledo 6* Oiio
Dear Harry*
I have given careful thought to your letter of February 16
regarding the solicitation of series for possible distribution
under the network's in-school service*
Frankly* X am not in sympathy with your basic premise * that
the members of the committee should not be engaged in soliciting
submissions* To adopt this position would be to reverse
historical precedent and to place the complete burden of another
responsibility onto an already overburdened central staff*
Perhaps the Association itself is to blame for not adequately
designating the functions of this committee* but* regardless of
the validity of that argument, this committee has always engaged
in the solicitation of submissions; the committee* throughout
its life span* has considered this function as one of its primary
functions* and rightly so* In my opinion.
Be that as it may* X believe the Issue should be resolved and
toward that end X have a proposal which either might be adopted
as proposed or used as a basis for future discussion,* X believe
one member of the committee* preferably the chairman, but not
necessarily so* should be charged with the responsibility of
soliciting submissions* This individual would then be discharged
from all judging responsibilities: his sole responsibility would
be in the area of solicitation. In determining areas of need
this individual would have the benefit of the committee's advice,
advice from other interested (and competent) parties not currently
serving on the committee* and his own good sense* The network
office would* of course* cooperate with this individual by
providing Information re submission procedures and handling the
distribution of submissions to the judging members of the commitÂ¬
tee*
